reviewText: 8 matches 4 title matches every major star you can think of at the time and yet this PPV fails. First match Shockmaster/Indian guy VS Harlem Heat/Equalizer- complete waste of time and you'll wanna fast forward Tugboat's fat ass. Next Match Steamboat VS Orndorff- Classic match that ends in a stale way watch it and you will agree. Next up is the TV title match between Regal and the Bulldog. I love the Bulldog and why did he never get a WCW title? Great match with another stale ending. Austin VS Rodes US title-These two fought at Havoc 91 and here they go again, decent match with an acutal winner. Scorpio/Bagwell VS Nastys for the Tag titles- this might be the best match of the night, excellent wrestling by both teams. Sting VS Sid also these two fought at Havoc 90 and they have anoher solid match 2gether, too short though. Next is Flair VS Rude for the real world title- Solid match wrestling by both but this is another match with a stale ending. I can watch any match with Rude in it. Next is the dreaded main event. It was supposed to be a death match but there are no 30 second rest periods in a death match. The match was also very sloppy not by Foley but by Vader, he looked terrible that night. Kinda surprising that he was the champ.Dumb ending to top off a wasted night that could have been so much better. Luckilly Jesse the Body does the commentating saving this PPV from complete disaster. It's not worth 50 bucks, only 20-25 the most
Title: N/A

reviewText: Halloween Havoc 1993 just like every WCW event in the early 90's was intense and hardcore.The classic match from spin the wheel make the deal between Cactus Jack and Big Van Vader was explosive.These two go all out in a brutal brawl that will always be one of my favorites for years to come.I saw this event live on pay-per-view and this was no disappointment.The under card was also good with matches involving The Nasty Boys, Steve Austin, Marcus Bagwell, 2 Cold Scorpio, Sting, Rick Rude, Rick Flair and many more.Another classic WCW event that shouldn't be missed.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The "Spin the Wheel, Make the Deal" Texas Death Match bwt Big Van Vader and Cactus Jack was one of the greatest matches of the year, no doubt.  In other great matches - the British Bulldog challenged fellow  Brit, WCW TV Champion Lord Steven Regal; Sting fought Sid Vicious for the  second time at a Halloween Havoc pay-per-view; "Stunning" Steve  Austin challenged US Champion Dustin Rhodes; the Nasty Boys challenged tag  team champs 2 Cold Scorpio and Marcus Bagwell; and a great world title  match between "Ravashing" Rick Rude and Ric Flair.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Once again I'm going to review an old school rasslin Pay Per View Halloween Havoc 1993 the 5th Halloween Havoc over all. So what has over the month since Fall Brawl. On The September 25th episode of WCW World Wide the main event of Halloween Havoc was made Big Van Vader vs Cactus Jack Spin The Wheel Make The Deal. If you haven't followed my reviews of Slamboree, Beach Blast & Fall Brawl then here's how it got to this point. In April Cactus Jack & Vader had back to back fights. In the 2nd match Vader power bombed Cactus Jack on the concrete. He was taken away in ambulance. Harley Race took this bag Cactus Jack had brought with him. About a month later a reporter named Catherine White tried to track Cactus Jack down eventually she found him in Clevland he had "amnesia" he didn't remember ever being a wrestler he forgot who his wife & son were. Then Cactus Jack returned at Clash Of The Champions 24 & went after Vader. Harley Race got Yoshi Kwan to face Cactus Jack at Fall Brawl. Jack won & got his bag back. On The October 9th episode of WCW Saturday Night Vader had to defen Th WCW World Heavyweight Championship against Ricky Steamboat it was a pretty good match Yoshi Kwan interfered & then Cactus Jack came out & hit Vader with a shovel & made the save. The following week on WCW Saturday Night Harley Race sent Yoshi Kwan after Cactus Jack again & again he beat Kwan. On The Octobe 23rd episode of WCW Saturday Night Cactus Jack cut an amazing promo. "When I look at this wheel I look at the set of best friends that I ever had! See I was only 7yrs old in The Summer Of 1972 when my dear sweet Mother sent me off to live with my Grandma. She thought that a little hard labor would calm the wild child down. Cause I was such a bad boy I was allowed to take only 1 toy. A bike with no brakes. See a bike with no brakes is no problem in New Mexico but when you ride the hill tops of upstate New York you find out it' a big problem. I tried to put my foot down I tried to stop the rolling & sliding. Then I found myself in the most painful situation of My life when I became entraped in old man Johnson's fence! I called out MOMMY MOMMY! She wasn't there! Then I called out DADDY DADDY! But I hadn't seen him in 5 years. Slowly but surely 1 wire by 1 wire I pulled the barbed wire out of my body! I ran home to Grandma she cleaned my wounds she sent me to bed! That night I couldn't sleep see it wasn't my wounds in the back of my mind I realised I liked it! I went & clipped a piece of barbed wire put it under my pillow & I slept like a baby! See the things that strike fear in normal mens hearts bring Cactus Jack comfort! & Vader Harley Race that's where you made your worst mistake!" Harley Race walked on stage Cactus Jack continued with this awesome promo. "You should've realised when Vader dropped my head on the concrete that I would be back! You need to realise that when man spins the wheel tomorrow night you're in for longest night of your life! BANG BANG!" Harley Race said I'm tired of waiting spin the wheel. Cactus Jack punched Race in the face & gave him a double arm DDT on the stage to close the show. On The October 2nd episode of WCW Saturday Night on the control center there would be rematch for the not NWA World Heavyweight Championship between Rick Rude & Ric Flair. The following week on WCW Saturday Night Tony Schiavone had a sit down interview with Rick Rude at his house. WCW has stated they don't recognise any other World title from any other promotion. They only recognise The WCW World Heavyweight Championship held by Big Van Vader. Rude said "Ever since I came in here in 91 & beat Sting their golden boy & won The United States Championship  they've had a conspiracy against me. I beat Flair at Fall Brawl for The World title & they don't recognise it. But what's this belt say?" Tony Schiavone: "It says World Heavyweight Wrestling Champion." Rude: "What did you call me at the start of this interview?" Schiavone: "The World Heavyweight Champion." The following week on WCW Saturday Night a 2nd Referee was added to the match. When I get into this show they address the World title situation. On The October 23rd episode of WCW Saturday Night Ric Flair cut a promo he's not only fighting for Fifi but he wants The World title back cause the Saturday Night after Halloween Havoc he's got to face Sid Vicious The winner will face Big Van Vader at Clash Of The Champions 25 for The WCW World Championship. So they can have a unification match for 1 World Champion. On episodes of World Wide The Hollywood Blonds & The Nasty Boys were beginning a feud cause they thought they had a deal with The Nasty Boys to hand The World Tag Team titles to them since they won at Fall Brawl. Those were all filmed 3 or 4 months in advance before Brian Pillman's injury. On The October 2nd episode of WCW Saturday Night Steve Austin expressed interest in going for The WCW United States Championship. Colonel Parker told Austin I want everyone all over the world to know the name of Stunning Steve Austin. The following week on WCW Saturday Night Colonel Parker told Austin that he could thank him for getting him his shot at The US Championship at Halloween Havoc. Colonel Parker also had been cutting in on The Hollywood Blonds promos & putting Brian Pillman down. Sid Vicious had been targeting Sting & viewed him as The Franchise of WCW so he got a match with Sting at Halloween Havoc. On The October 9th episode of WCW Saturday Night problems begin with Sid & Colonel Parker he Steve Austin a shot at The US title but he hasn't got him a shot at either World title. On The October 9th episode of WCW Saturday Night 2 Cold Scorpio & Marcus Alexander Bagwell beat The Nasty Boys & they got a shot at The World Tag Team Championship at Halloween Havoc the following week on WCW Saturday Night 2 Cold & Bagwell humiliated The Nasty Boy again. On The October 23rd episode of WCW Saturday Night The Nasty Boy put Yhe Tag titles on The line against 2 Cold Scorpio & Marcus Alexander Bagwell they got Theodore Long as their Manager & they won The WCW World Tag Team Championship. The British Bulldog got a random TV title match at Halloween Havoc. On The October 23rd episode of WCW Saturday Night The Bulldog was cutting a promo & Sir William came out & started something with The Bulldog it looked like he was going to press slam him until Steve Regal came out & hit The British Bulldog with a Cricket Bat. So that is the backstory comment if you like the backstory being told. The buyrate was an 0.50 that is down from last years 0.90.Date October 24, 1993Attendance 6,000Venue Lakefront ArenaThe opening to this Pay Per View is weird. So you have Eric Bischoff dressed as General Custer & Tony Schiavone is dressed as Jesse Ventura for Halloween.Ice TrainCharlie Norris& The ShockmasterDefHarlem HeatBooker T & Stevie Ray& The Equalizer. * & half stars Not good but Harlem Heat were fine but The Shockmaster Ice Train Charlie Norris & The Equalizer are nothing to get excited over. The Shockmaster beat Booker T with a bear hug for the 2nd straight PPV. Eric Bischoff interviews Terry Taylor for who will be The Special Guest Referee for The Rude Flair match. He said he wants to The Referee cause I have done a lot of bad things in the past. But this is the change to do something good for a change. I may make an unpopular decision but I will call it straight down the middle.Paul Orndorff with The Masked Assassin Def Ricky Steamboat *** by countout this was a rematch from The Clash Of Champions 24 that was a good match too. The Masked Assassin put something in his mask & hit Steamboat in the head. Originally it was suppose to be Steamboat & Yoshi Kwan but we got a better match.Tony Schiavone said that our offices in Alanta got a memo from Promoters in Japan, South Korea, South America, Mexico Canada, England Germany South Africa calling themselves "The WCW International" & that they recognise the former NWA World Championship as a World title so Rude will be defending The WCW World International Heavyweight Championship against Ric Flair.WCW Televison ChampionshipChampion Steven Regal with Sir William vs The British Bulldog went the time limit ** & 3 quarters of a star a near 3 star match that is nice & competitive.Vader comes out & Spins The Wheel & Makes The Deal it lands on a Texas Death Match.WCW United States ChampionshipChampion Dustin Rhodes Def Steve Austin **& half starsA fan had a sign that said Stunning Steve is The Wrestler Of The 90's I bet they didn't know how right they were. Decent match btw. Austin hit Rhodes with The US title belt after the match. & left with the belt.They show where 2 Cold & Bagwell won The World Tag Team Championship the night before.WCW World Tag Team ChampionshipThe Nasty Boys Brian Knobs & Jerry Sagswith Missy Hyatt Def  Champions 2 Cold Scopio & Marcus Alexander Bagwell with Theodore Long ** 2 Cold Scorpio & Marcus Bagwell only got a day reign 3 weeks if you count when the title change was tapped. It didn't mean much. I agree with most people that The Nasty Boys are horrible but the mat was given a resonable amount of time not 26 minutes like at Fall Brawl.Eric Bischoff interviewed Sid ViciousSting Def Sid Vicious with Colonel Parker * & 3 quarters of a starThis was a rematch of sorts from Halloween Havoc 90. Colonel Parker accidentally held to Sid's leg they started arguing & Sting got the win. Sid is mad at The Colonel & no it didn't mean anything.They show Vader  &  Cactus Jack preparing backstage.WCW World International Heavyweight ChampionshipChampion Rick Rude Def Ric Flair with Fifi by disqualification **** Terry Taylor was 2nd Referee on the outsideNick Patrick was knocked out. Terry Taylor tried to Ref it. Rude got his knucks Flair took them from him & hit him with them. It looked like he was going to win but Patrick saw what he did & was disqualified. As the fans yelledbulls  h  i  t! Rude tried to carry Fifi off Flair stopped him Rude ran off with The International title.Texas Death Match non titleBig Van Vader with Harley Race Def Cactus Jack ****Great match both guys beat the p  h  u  c  k out out each other. Both did massive blade jobs. Harley Race used a tazer on Cactus Jack Vader was the last man standing.This Pay Per View was an improvement over Fall Brawl & better than any of the 1st 4 Halloween Havoc's The undrcard was decent. Great match with Vader & Cactus Jack. Despite The DQ ending Ric Flair vs Rick Rude for The World International title was great. Ricky Steamboat vs Paul Orndorff was a good match. Steve Austin vs Dustin Rhodes US title match  was decent.  Regal vs The Bulldog was more than decent. The opening 6 man tag was really the only bad match even that was sort of watchable. Sting vs Sid Vicious was ok. It's an excellent show. The next retro rasslin review will be Battlebowl a throwaway show.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The 6 man tag team match between the team of Ice Train,The Shockmaster & Charlie Norris against the team of The Equalizer & Harlem Heat was a dud. The Paul Orndorff-Ricky "The Dragon" Steamboat match while not a bad bout,it ran much too long for it's own good. The TV Title match between Lord Steven Regal & Davey Boy Smith was awesome despite the time limit draw at the end. The US title match between Dustin Rhodes & "Stunning" Steve Austin was not great but pretty good. The World Tag Team title match between The Nasty Boys & the team of 2 Cold Scorpio & Marcus Bagwell was a boring dud. The Sid Vicious-Sting was a super duper alley ooper dud. The International title match between Rick Rude & Rick Flair was good to say the least but it could have done better. The Texas Death Match between Vader & Cactus Jack was a wild,chaotic & sick brawl and a good reminder of the 1990's ECW. I give this PPV a 5 out of 10.
Title: N/A

reviewText: All the Matches were great and Cactus And Vader had a Classic death Match to Boot.
Title: N/A

reviewText: First thing, I like WCW, I watched WCW since 1992.  Second thing, I like Cactus Jack and Vader.  With that said, this is the most overhyped and overrated match of all time, I am talking about Cactus Jack vs Vader(death match).  The match is slow, its sloppy and the rules make no sense.  Gary Capetta says their can only be a winner by Pinfalls or Submission and then right after it says Pinfalls dont count???  Then they have a 30 second rest period after pinfalls (which is more like whenever the ref feels like telling em to go at it again) and why do they have that?  both guys looked ready to go after each other seconds after the pinfall.  Then when the match is over, the fans nor myself even realize it..a delayed reaction.  "Oh its over?!"  completely messed up all around.  The hardcore wasnt that special...even for 1993.  WCW had done more hardcore things in 1992 and more exciting.  The best part of the match was Cactus being squashed on the ramp by Vader.  Otherwise, this match was a mess.  The rest of the ppv was average.  so I give it 2 stars.  I didnt like it when I watched it back then and its even worse now.
Title: N/A
